1106213372280926209.text:
My absolute favorite new Linux command: `netstat -peanut` 

It displays every single info about network connections and open ports that processes hold, and you can grep the program to get a summary of what a specific process is doing!

1110894000997912582.text: Can we please delete section 12.2 (Random Numbers) from the #Ethereum yellow paper? At least drop the "unknowable" part. It's been proven time and time again that random numbers based on block hashes are useless (proxy contract can forward a tx on favorable outcome only).

1107614634905927681.text: We've just started a benchmark to compare the archive (big scary node) sync time of Geth v1.8.23 (stable) vs. v1.9.0 (unstable). We're running the comparison on two i3.2xlarge instances (it will only fit the state up to ~6.8M). Any bets on how much time it will take?

1111155515738988545.text: Unpopular opinion: I have no problem whatsoever repeating ‘if err != nil’ all the time in #golang. In fact, the pattern becomes a glanceable way to see the places where your code can error. I can usually see, quite quickly, if errors are being ignored because of the shape of code

1114167656628871168.text: I love hearing this! I'm doing some tests with Geth v1.9.0 and it's reached block 4.7M in 36h, if it continues with the average of the last 3h (3.86 blks/s) it'll be synchronized in 200 hours (~10 days in total). This really sounds promising, congrats for the awesome work!pic.twitter.com/wqHzdigRK1
